style.style_why: 대체 왜 여기서까지 적을 스폰하는 거야

cyberGrind.cybergrind_wavesDescription2: (최고 기록이 선택할 단계의 두 배 이상이어야 함.)

books.books_limboFourth2: ...나의 마음은 영원한 고통에 휩쓸리고 있네. 음침한 색채로 그려진 망측한 풍경화, 닿기만 하면 소리지르는 공허한 벽. 그칠 줄 모르는 조롱의 노래, 심지어 새 지저귀는 소리는 가짜다. 모든 것이 내가 지옥에 있다는 것을 상기시킨다.
books.books_limboFourth3: 가브리엘 나의 사랑하는 친구여, 끝없는 참회 속에서 나는 자네의 천국으로의 수용을 기다리고 있다네. 나는 운명을 받아들이면서도, 가장 성실하게 지내왔건만, 대체 무엇을 위해 그랬을까? 이것은 대체 무슨 형벌이기에, 구원에 대한 일말의 가능성도 없는 파멸로 향하는 열쇠를 쥐고 있어야 한단 말인가... 해골들은 악마같은 조소로 나를 비웃고 있고, 소리 내어 떠들며, 나를 더 깊은 지옥의 구렁텅이로 떨어지도록 꼬드기고 있네... 나는 그렇게 하지 않을 것일세.
books.books_limboFourth4: 나는 그 해골들을 식기, 책, 그리고 이 저주받은 곳의 근원에 숨겨놓았다네. 용서해주게 가브리엘, 자네를 기다리겠네...
books.books_lustSecond2: ...우리가 공명정대함을 외칠 때, 가브리엘이 미노스를 쓰러뜨렸고, 미노스의 찢어진 살갗을 타고 흐르는 핏빛 물결은 그의 발치에 고였다.
books.books_lustSecond3: '정의', 우리의 정의로운 지도자가 고통에 겨워 소리지르고 몸을 비트는 동안, 가브리엘은 정의를 선포했다, "주님의 뜻대로 이루어질지어다."
books.books_lustSecond4: 우리는 미노스 왕이 스러지고, 무너져, 이제 신의 의지, 가브리엘로부터의 저항을 울부짖는 모습을 그저 공포 속에서 지켜볼 수 밖에 없었다.
books.books_greedSecond2: 마지막으로 천사를 본 지 며칠이 되었다. 천사들의 억압이 없는 이상, 우리는 우리의 벌을 계속 받을 필요가 없다. 지옥으로 떨어진 사람들 중 가장 온순한 자들마저 싸우기 위해 참회를 그만두었다. 모두가 그들이 어떻게 우리의 마음과, 몸과, 영혼을 빼앗고, 오지 않을 구원을 향한 희망만을 남겨두었는지만을 보았지만, 이제는 아니다.
books.books_greedSecond3: 시시포스 왕께서는 지금까지 비밀리에 움직여, 군대를 집결해 그 힘과 수를 엄청나게 늘려왔지만, 이제 더 이상 숨을 이유는 없다. 우리는 천국의 그늘에서 두려움을 잊어버릴 수 있을 만큼 오래 살아왔다. 이제 시시포스의 반란군은 전쟁을 준비하고 있다.
books.books_greedSecond4: 미노스가 평화로운 혁명을 시작했다는 소식을 들었지만, 우리의 시시포스 왕은 그런 온건함은 우리를 가둔 잔학한 자들에게 환영받지 못한다는 것을 알고 계시다. 왕께서는 오직 힘만이 힘을 이길 수 있다고 생각하시고, 우리를 자유로 이끌어주실 것일 터이다.
books.books_greedSecond5: 다만 우리가 그 고통이 우리에게 들이닥칠 것임을 알았더라면...
books.books_greedThird1: 피라미드 안에 고양이와 쥐의 방이 있다.
books.books_greedThird2: 방 안에 맑은 물이 고여 있다.
books.books_greedThird4: 그러나 드루이드의 <color=cyan>전기</color> 마법을 쓰는 자만이 그것을 찾을 수 있으리라.
books.books_wrathSecond3: 필멸자의 세계에 어떤 재앙이 덮쳤다. 한때 스틱스 강이었던 것은 이제 헤아릴 수 없이 깊은 바다가 되었다. 날마다 수백만의 흐느끼는 영혼들이 해변을 가득 채울 정도로 쏟아져 내렸다. 통곡하는 파도가 넘쳐 흘러, 허리 굽혀 절하고, 자비를 구하며, 안전하게 강을 건너고 싶다고 애원했다. 하지만 모든 영혼이 값을 치르지는 못하고, 이 늙은이의 손은 그 많은 동전을 받기에 역부족이었다.
books.books_wrathSecond4: 그러던 어느 날. 세상의 멱을 따고 머리를 젖혀 망자를 들이붓기라도 하는 듯 수백, 수천만 명의 물결이 몇 분 동안 그침 없이 파도쳐 들어왔다. 내가 반응할 시간조차 없었다. 끝없는 노동으로 지친 내 몸은 나를 요동치는 바다 속에 미끄러져, 스틱스 해의 밑바닥에 떨어지게 했고, 셀 수 없이 많은 사람들에 깔린 내가 맞이할 운명은 하나뿐이었다.
books.books_wrathSecond5: 갑자기, 주님께서 오시기라도 한 듯이 밝은 빛이 나타나, 내가 겪어본 적 없는 연민과 온정을 담아 굳센 손으로 나를 어둠으로부터 이끌어주면서:
books.books_wrathSecond6: "두려워하지 마라, 죄인아. 너의 헌신이 네 속의 선함을 보여주니; 진실로 가득하구나. 마음은 원하지만, 몸은 쉬어야 하니, 주님의 피조물 하나가 허투루 쓰이지 않도록 하라."
books.books_wrathSecond7: 그의 부드러운 음성은 고통을 녹이고 내 상처를 고쳐 주었다. 나는 기쁨의 눈물로 얼굴을 적셨고, 내가 짊어진 사명의 무게로 인해 감히 입을 열 수 없었다. 나는 천사님의 포용에 감동해, 경의를 표할 수밖에 없었다.
books.books_wrathSecond8: 그가 내 어둠 속의 빛이니, 가브리엘은 실로 찬란하시다.

intermission.act1_intermission_first3: 의회의 발치에서 초라한 모습으로 받는 눈총.
intermission.act1_intermission_first4: 그들은 씁쓸한 분개의 눈빛으로, 모두에게 보일 만큼 크게 벌어진 가브리엘의 몸과 마음에 난 상처를 노려보았다.
intermission.act1_intermission_first5: 이 자가 우리의 창조주에 대한 도리를 저버렸는가?
intermission.act1_intermission_first6: 신성한 빛은 지닐 자격이 없는 자로다.
intermission.act1_intermission_first8: 이 자는 그걸 낭비하고 있는 모양이군.
intermission.act1_intermission_first9: 그들의 음성이 가브리엘의 사지에 공진해, 한 가닥 번개처럼 타고 흘러, 범골이었다면 눈이 멀고 귀가 먹었을 정도로 내리쳐 그을음을 남겼다.
intermission.act1_intermission_first10: 이 자 속에 있는 신성한 빛과, 폭풍 같은 신성한 불굴의 분노.
intermission.act1_intermission_first11: 감히 물건 따위가 넘볼 수 없는 것이다.
intermission.act1_intermission_second1: "신성한 의회시여, 저희 창조주에 대한 제 헌신은 절대적입니다. 저는 한 번도 아버지 뜻에서 벗어난 적이 없었습니다, 하지만 한 기계가-"
intermission.act1_intermission_second2: "감히 아버지의 뜻이 물건 따위에게 흔들릴 수 있다고 말하는 건가?"
intermission.act1_intermission_second7: "네 배신은 결코 용서받지 못할 것이다. 그 벌로, 아버지의 빛이 너에게서 떨어져 나갈 것이다."
intermission.act1_intermission_second8: 24시간 뒤 그 잔불이 모두 스러질 것이고."
intermission.act1_intermission_third1: 그의 존재에서 빛이 뜯겨 나가니, 가브리엘의 비명은 나지막하게 신을 찬양하는 기도문에 파묻혔다.
intermission.act1_intermission_third2: 지옥의 불과도 비교할 수 없는 끓어오르는 통한.
intermission.act1_intermission_third3: 고통의 불꽃 속에서 하나의 타오르는 증오가 새로 생겨났다.
intermission.act1_intermission_third4: 기계가 피를 찾는다면, 그는 순순히 내어줄 것이다;
intermission.act1_intermission_third5: 그리고 그 정도 분노라면, 쇠붙이도 피를 흘릴 것이다.
intermission.act2_intermission_first5: 대체 그는 얼마나 잔학했던 것이며... 무슨 목표를 위해 그랬던 것일까?
intermission.act2_intermission_first6: 얼마나 많은 자들을 지옥에 떨어뜨렸으며, 그래서 누가 이익을 보았는가..?
intermission.act2_intermission_first7: 기계로부터의 두 번의 패배가 가브리엘을 변화시켰다.
intermission.act2_intermission_first8: 한때 신의 의지를 받드는 세계였던 것은 이제 산산조각났으며 그는 그저 그 조각을 다시 맞추려 하고 있었다.
intermission.act2_intermission_first9: 그들은 새 연료로 살릴 수 없는, 죽어가는 불 곁에 모였고, 새로운 빛은 가브리엘에게 진실을 보여주었다:
intermission.act2_intermission_second1: 신의 의지를 계승하는 "사람" 의 의회는 이제 그곳에 없었다.
intermission.act2_intermission_second4: 의회는 아직도 신의 불꽃을 좇았으며, 그 음성과 의지에 대한 기억은 뒤틀리고 왜곡되었고, 천국의 나머지 대다수는 맹목적으로 그들의 자취를 따를 뿐이었다.
intermission.act2_intermission_second5: 그 천사들은 지금까지도 아버지의 이름으로 행동하지만 하느님의 나라는 이미 바뀌었다.
intermission.act2_intermission_second6: 불은 이제 꺼져가고 있고, 열을 얻는 것에 실패해 계속 끊기고 있었다.
intermission.act2_intermission_second7: 가브리엘은 완벽한 명료한의 눈빛으로 잔불을 바라보았다.
intermission.act2_intermission_second8: 그는 칼을 뽑아 스러져 가는 빛에 비추어 보았다.
intermission.act2_intermission_second9: 칼은 더 이상 타인의 의지로 움직이지 않고, 스스로 움직이는, 새로이 탄생한 무기를 비추고 있었다.
intermission.act2_intermission_second10: 그는 말로는 결코 대중을 움직일 수 없다고 생각했다.
intermission.act2_intermission_second11: 대신 더 과감한 방법을 쓰기로 했다.
intermission.act2_intermission_third2: The littered corpses of the once mighty council now strewn against its surfaces, their last gasps of life dripping down the dissident blade of Gabriel's sword.
intermission.act2_intermission_third3: The last councilor, now backed up to a wall, scrambles for words between panicked breaths as death approaches with measured steps.
intermission.act2_intermission_third5: Y-you can't do this! Our status forbids it!
intermission.act2_intermission_third7: We are the supreme authority, our law commands you!"
intermission.act2_intermission_third9: Your words hold no power over me, or anyone else.
intermission.act2_intermission_third10: Lest you truly believe you can talk my blade back into its sheath."
intermission.act2_intermission_fourth1: "B-but the people are on our side!
intermission.act2_intermission_fourth2: The citizens of Heaven know that we are just!"
intermission.act2_intermission_fourth3: "The masses only follow you out of fear and desperation.
intermission.act2_intermission_fourth4: I will show them there is nothing to be afraid of, for there is no species nor origin, vested rank or holy status that will stop the sharp edge of a sword.
intermission.act2_intermission_fourth5: We all bleed the same blood, and the cushions of your thrones have made you weak and impotent."
intermission.act2_intermission_fourth7: The council follows the will of The Father!
intermission.act2_intermission_fourth8: You seek to go against our creato-"
intermission.act2_intermission_fourth13: Gabriel's silhouette now towers over the councilor, his shadow cast upon a soon lifeless corpse.
intermission.act2_intermission_fifth1: He raises his sword for the final cut as the crying mess on the floor stammers out its final feeble argument.
intermission.act2_intermission_fifth3: Without me you cannot hope to reconnect with it! I-i-if you kill me, you'll be dead in a matter of hours!"
intermission.act2_intermission_fifth5: A clean, silent cut glides through the councilor's neck, severing his spine with elegance and ease.
intermission.act2_intermission_fifth6: His head falls onto the marble floor, the rest of his body following soon after.
intermission.act2_intermission_sixth1: Bereft of status but brimming with purpose, Gabriel gave a final message to the angels amassed at the gates of the auditorium before leaving Heaven for the very last time.
intermission.act2_intermission_sixth2: His arm outstretched, without a word, the people saw.
intermission.act2_intermission_sixth3: In the silence the message rang out to the far ends of the cosmos.
intermission.act1_intermission_insertAct2: II막 : 불완전한 증오를 재생하려면 디스크 2를 넣으십시오

frontend.difficulty_tweakReminder: 난이도는 설정의 어시스트 메뉴에서 세밀하게 조정할 수 있습니다
frontend.difficulty_harmlessDescription1: 말도 안 되게 느린 적과 공격들.
frontend.difficulty_harmlessDescription2: 피해량은 여전히 높으나, 산이라도 피할 수 있을 겁니다.
frontend.difficulty_harmlessDescription3: 스트레스 없는 경험을 원하는 플레이어에게 추천합니다.
frontend.difficulty_lenientDescription1: 피해량은 높지만 공격이 더 느리고 적은 소극적임.
frontend.difficulty_lenientDescription2: 긴장을 늦출 정도는 아니지만, 공격을 더 쉽게 피할 수 있습니다.
frontend.difficulty_lenientDescription3: 덜 엄격한 게임플레이 경험을 원하는 플레이어에게 추천합니다.
frontend.difficulty_standardDescription2: 공격은 쉽게 피할 수 있지만, 방심하면 한순간에 죽을 수 있습니다.
frontend.difficulty_violentDescription2: 빠른 사고와, 어느 정도의 기동성 그리고 상황에 대한 인지가 필수적입니다.
frontend.difficulty_violentDescription3: 게임의 빠르기와 기저 작용에 대해 익숙해진 플레이어에게 추천합니다.

visualnovel.visualnovel_introFirst3: It might already be too late.
visualnovel.visualnovel_introFirst4: The labyrinthine pathways of arbitrary sharp turns seemed stranger and stranger as panic blotted out the once deeply ingrained memories that usually guided me.
visualnovel.visualnovel_introSecond1: I bit down harder on the last of my rations, held only by the skin of my teeth.
visualnovel.visualnovel_introSecond2: It barely hung on as I kept frantically looking around, hoping for the few scraps of burning memory of mine to find a familiar sight that would lead me to salvation.
visualnovel.visualnovel_introSecond3: The gates must be closing by now.
visualnovel.visualnovel_introSecond4: The last few barely making it.
visualnovel.visualnovel_introSecond5: The rest of us never stood a chance.
visualnovel.visualnovel_introSecond6: Suddenly, from a blind spot, a figure struck me.
visualnovel.visualnovel_introSecond7: There was no time to react before I came crashing down onto the cold hard ground.
visualnovel.visualnovel_introSecond8: I struggled to regain my senses to at least see what fate would befall me in my final moments, but even in this abyss of endless terror, my mind could never have imagined the horror I witnessed.
visualnovel.visualnovel_fallenResponseFirst: I'm just someone who got knocked over by some half-brained fuckface who doesn't even have the decency to ask if I'm fine or apologize before starting an interrogation.
visualnovel.visualnovel_fallenResponseSecond: Well I just got knocked over by some blind-by-choice asshole who gave my skirt a decorative dirt coating, so all in all fucking fantastic, though I would prefer to not be on the ground right now.
visualnovel.visualnovel_fallenResponseThird1: Oh great I just got hit-and-ran by a vibrating fountain, just my luck.
visualnovel.visualnovel_fallenResponseThird2: At least you could help me up before the rest of you gets melted by the sun or jackhammers itself into the Earth's mantle.
visualnovel.visualnovel_kindFirst2: Hey, sorry about being rude like that, I'm just real frustrated that I'm not only late for school, but also managed to get lost on the way there.
visualnovel.visualnovel_kindSecond: Though, by the looks of it, you're pretty much on the same boat, and by a stroke of once-in-a-lifetime luck you just happened to bump into the ~prettiest girl in town~.
visualnovel.visualnovel_kindThird: So how about you lead the way and get both of us out of this jam?
visualnovel.visualnovel_rudeFirst2: I don't know who you are but you've got a lot of nerve smacking someone down and not even bothering to help them back up, but since your mother didn't teach you manners, I'll let this one slide.
visualnovel.visualnovel_rudeSecond: By the looks of it, you're late for school as well, and by a stroke of once-in-a-lifetime luck you just happened to bump into the prettiest girl in town.
visualnovel.visualnovel_rudeThird: So I'll forgive you for your extreme transgression of laying your hands on a fair maiden if you tell me which way to go, since I seem to have gotten lost on the way.
visualnovel.visualnovel_middleResponseFirst2: Though in retrospect, I guess you wouldn't be here with me right now if you weren't lost as well...
visualnovel.visualnovel_middleResponseFirst3: Oh well, no point in crying over spilled blood.
visualnovel.visualnovel_middleResponseFirst4: We might as well just wait for another student to come by and follow them instead.
visualnovel.visualnovel_middleResponseFirst6: Don't bother telling me your name though, I don't really care.
visualnovel.visualnovel_middleResponseSecond2: THE FUCK DO YOU MEAN 'DON'T WANNA'?
visualnovel.visualnovel_middleResponseSecond3: If you DON'T show me the way then YOU'RE never arriving either!
visualnovel.visualnovel_middleResponseSecond4: Or did that thought not even cross your crayon-fed brain cavity!?
visualnovel.visualnovel_middleResponseThird2: Cut the crap, I can see your crusty-ass uniform and no living person would dare to go out looking like a filled trash bag by choice!
visualnovel.visualnovel_middleResponseThird3: Though considering how little activity there actually is inside your skull, I'm willing to admit you sure as hell don't seem like you've ever been to school.
visualnovel.visualnovel_middlePromptSecondRecklessne: "You could do with being a bit nicer to people you've only just met."
visualnovel.visualnovel_middlePromptSecondWaiting: "Just waiting here won't get us anywhere, we should be looking for a way to the school."
visualnovel.visualnovel_recklessnessFirst: Yeah? Well you could do with a beatdown, so fuck off.
visualnovel.visualnovel_recklessnessSecond2: I don't really care about what you or anyone else thinks of me, so I'm not interested in trying to be nice just so you'll be in a good mood.
visualnovel.visualnovel_recklessnessPrompt1: Why not? If we're stuck in here together anyway, what's the point in making it worse for both of us?
visualnovel.visualnovel_recklessnessPrompt2: I find that hard to believe considering how heated up you get from practically anything I say.
visualnovel.visualnovel_recklessnessResponseFirst1: What's the point of making it better?
visualnovel.visualnovel_recklessnessResponseFirst2: What's the point of even bothering to care?
visualnovel.visualnovel_recklessnessResponseFirst3: Hell, what's the point of anything at all?
visualnovel.visualnovel_recklessnessResponseSecond2: Blowing off steam is just how I cope.
visualnovel.visualnovel_waitingFirst: Wandering around like headless chickens would only get us even more lost.
visualnovel.visualnovel_waitingSecond: Since we were both heading to school and ended up meeting right here, that means there's a very high likelihood this spot is somewhere along the way.
visualnovel.visualnovel_waitingThird1: Therefore, we'll be better off just staying put and waiting for someone who DOES know the way.
visualnovel.visualnovel_waitingThird2: It's basic logic, you should look it up sometime.
visualnovel.visualnovel_waitingPromptFirst1: Basic logic or not, we're already late and I'm not planning on waiting here until tomorrow morning.
visualnovel.visualnovel_waitingPromptFirst2: Anyone who knows the way will already have gone there. Sounds to me like you're just looking for an excuse to give up.
visualnovel.visualnovel_waitingResponseFirst1: Suit yourself. I'll stay here until the heat death of the universe if that means I don't have to run around looking for some magical memory-triggering pebble on the ground.
visualnovel.visualnovel_waitingResponseFirst2: Couldn't care less about being late for school.
visualnovel.visualnovel_waitingResponseSecond2: Can't give up if I never tried in the first place, and I don't make a habit out of trying.
visualnovel.visualnovel_waitingResponseThird2: There's no point in trying if the end result will be the same anyway.
visualnovel.visualnovel_waitingResponseThird3: Try as you might, you'll eventually just become forgotten dust in the wind like the rest of us.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism1: I mean really, take a moment to think about it.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism2: The human mind, in its complete vastness, is capable of recognizing its utter helplessness and uselessness in the face of inevitable and unavoidable non-existence, but is incapable of coming to terms with it.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism3: We can only ever ignore it, hide from it or temporarily escape from it, but the fact is that we are bound to the way of all things.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism4: Death is unavoidable, not only to us, but all that exists or ever has existed.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism5: Every living being will eventually die out.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism6: Every speck of matter will eventually wither away and dissipate into entropy.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism7: It doesn't matter if you lived a good life or if you left a legacy behind.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism8: It doesn't matter if humanity survives for a thousand years or dies out tomorrow.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism9: The end result is the same: the absolute nothing.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism10: Human intelligence is far beyond that of other animals, but it would be misguided to consider that a gift.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism11: All other beings have the gift of ignorance, of not understanding what we do.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism12: Our intelligence is not a gift. It's a flaw.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism14: Intelligence, once a great feature in aeons past, continued to grow unchecked and unfiltered, and has since passed a threshold whereupon it is no longer a benefit, but an active danger to its host.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism15: Much like the Irish elk, a species of deer that, through uncountable generations of evolution, grew antlers so wide and vast that it could no longer run from predators, eventually leading to extinction.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism16: The human mind is an evolutionary maladaptation caused by going too far in a direction that was once beneficial and will, sooner or later, lead to our extinction.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism17: On an individual level, it's already happening.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism18: Existential dread is already taking hold.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism19: I'm sure you've felt it too.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism20: The pain and fear of being nothing, becoming nothing.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism22: We are unable to come to terms with it, so we hide from our own intelligence.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism24: We stop ourselves from thinking deeply about what will happen when we die.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism26: We keep our minds busy with mundane activities and entertainment to stop ourselves from having to come face-to-face with the truth.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism28: We transform our self-reflective suffering into another form, art, to keep it from consuming us.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism30: But these ways are all simply temporary.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism31: They're just there to push back the inevitable veil of helplessness and despair that would encompass and ruin us.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism33: There's no point in trying to find joy in life, for life in and of itself is suffering.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt2: You criticize those who consider our vast intelligence a gift, and yet, also misguide yourself to believe our meaninglessness is a curse.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt3: Nothing we do matters in the end, and that is precisely why we are not shackled by the burden of expectations, the fear of eternal judgement or the failure to meet up to an arbitrary definition of what makes our limited time 'not wasted'.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt4: Time cannot be wasted, for there is no greater purpose to life than simply living it.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt6: Because we have no greater purpose, we are free to set our own. To create self-defined goals for which to strive.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt7: For some it may be nothing. For some it may be pleasure. For some it may be creation. For some it may be improving the lives of others.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt8: It is because we have no greater purpose, that time spent on goals set by one's self cannot be time wasted.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt9: In the end, nothing matters, and therefore you have no reason not to do what you want rather than whatever illusion of greater purpose is forced on you by others or even your own misguided thoughts.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt10: And it is a thought worth fearing. However, abandoning purpose, hope, choice, goals, pleasure and will can not make that thought disappear. The fear, however, can subside.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt11: Giving up is not accepting the end, it is simply accepting the fear of it. It is embracing despair rather than facing it.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt12: This is true. The emotional is not controlled by the logical. However, they are interlinked.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt13: Just as the deepest, darkest depths of despair can overthrow reason and the logical, warping them to fit into that haze of depression, so too can reason influence and overpower emotion, regardless of how impenetrable its defences may seem.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt14: By continually forcing to subvert those creeping negative thoughts with the positive logical ones, the emotional mind will eventually, slowly, gradually start to shape to fit the logical.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt15: It is not an easy job.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt16: It is not a quick job.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt17: It will sometimes feel like an impossible job.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt19: With an immense amount of time, effort and energy, it will improve.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilismPrompt22: And during the hardest times, when all seems lost and you want to give up, never forget...
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism36: But still, in that case, the meaninglessness of our actions draws to the same conclusion -- There is no reason to act, for any action is simply a temporary fluctuation that will, nevertheless, lead to the same conclusion.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism37: I do understand what you mean.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism38: However, that doesn't ease my fear of the end.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism39: Even if I were to try to find purpose, I would still be paralyzed by the thought of becoming nothing.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism41: Though as much as I'd like to embrace it, I am nevertheless struck with that paralyzing existential panic.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism42: I understand it logically, and I know that there is no reason to live in apathy, but my emotional side refuses to listen.
visualnovel.visualnovel_nihilism43: The fear persists, and I cannot motivate myself to seek purpose, despite knowing I must.
visualnovel.visualnovel_conclusion2: Guess you got a good head on your shoulders after all.
visualnovel.visualnovel_conclusion5: I feel like I've just shed the weight of the world off my back.
visualnovel.visualnovel_conclusion6: Or rather, you've done that for me.
visualnovel.visualnovel_conclusion7: And honestly, from the bottom of my heart...
visualnovel.visualnovel_conclusion9: You've given me a lot to think about, and while I'm sure I have a long and hard road ahead of me, I'm optimistic.
visualnovel.visualnovel_conclusion10: For the first time in what feels like an eternity, I'm optimistic.
visualnovel.visualnovel_conclusion11: Say... We're already way too late for school and it's become quite clear by now that nobody's going to come lead us there, so how about you and I ditch that passion-draining penitentiary and go grab something to eat, eh?
visualnovel.visualnovel_conclusionPrompt1: Yeah, sure. I've got nothing better to do today. You're paying, though.
visualnovel.visualnovel_conclusionPrompt2: Nah, sorry. To be honest I'm still kinda mad at for you how rude you were to me.
visualnovel.visualnovel_conclusionResponseFirst3: I do owe you one anyway, so what better time to cash out your 'did a nice thing to a girl way out of my league' coupon than now, eh?
visualnovel.visualnovel_conclusionResponseSecond2: Offer still stands though, in case you change your mind at any point.

options.assists_majorAssistsDisclaimer1: Major Assists consists of modifiers that change the game and its balance considerably.
options.assists_majorAssistsDisclaimer2: If "Major Assists" is enabled at any point during a mission, the rank gained upon completion will have a blue background. This background can be removed by achieving the same rank or higher with "Major Assists" disabled for the duration of the entire mission.
options.assists_majorAssistsDisclaimer3: Perfect ranks and Cyber Grind high scores cannot be achieved with "Major Assists" enabled.
options.save_warning2: If you're in a mission, you current progress will be lost.
options.save_deleteWarning1: Are you sure you want to DELETE SLOT

levelTips.leveltips_preludeSecond1: Hitscan weapons like the Revolver do locational damage.
levelTips.leveltips_preludeSecond2: A headshot deals 2x damage and a limbshot deals 1.5x damage.
levelTips.leveltips_preludeThird3: Jump: Quickly out of melee range, less control
levelTips.leveltips_preludeFourth2: A point-blank Shotgun shot to the torso right before an enemy attack lands will deal massive damage.
levelTips.leveltips_preludeFifth: Attack sound cues allow you to keep track of enemies who are off screen.
levelTips.leveltips_limboFirst: Some enemies make idle sounds to make them easier to track.
levelTips.leveltips_limboSecond: Use the ATTRACTOR NAILGUN's magnets to form concentrated orbs of nails that can be moved around using the pull force of other magnets.
levelTips.leveltips_limboThird1: Enemies can hurt other enemy types.
levelTips.leveltips_limboThird2: With quick thinking and positioning, powerful enemies can turn into powerful weapons.
levelTips.leveltips_limboFourth: The ATTRACTOR NAILGUN's magnets can be attached to enemies to make mobile targets easy to hit with nails.
levelTips.leveltips_lustFirst: Enemies scream when falling from a fatal height.
levelTips.leveltips_lustSecond2: Jump immediately after landing from a ground slam to jump higher.
levelTips.leveltips_lustSecond3: The longer the ground slam fall, the higher the bounce.
levelTips.leveltips_lustThird: RAILCANNON variations all share the same cooldown. Choose wisely which variation best fits the situation.
levelTips.leveltips_lustFourth1: SLIDING will retain previous momentum for a short amount of time.
levelTips.leveltips_lustFourth2: Chaining quick SLIDE JUMPS after a DASH JUMP will give you incredible sustained speed.
levelTips.leveltips_gluttonyFirst: Environmental hazards such as harmful liquids will hurt enemies as well.
levelTips.leveltips_gluttonySecond1: If you're having trouble keeping up with a tough enemy, stand back and observe.
levelTips.leveltips_gluttonySecond2: Every enemy has its tells and patterns and learning those can be your key to victory.
levelTips.leveltips_greedFirst: HITSCAN weapons can be used to hit the shotgun's CORE EJECT in mid-air to increase its damage and blast radius.
levelTips.leveltips_greedThird: Hitting an enemy with only the edge of an explosion will launch them without dealing much damage, making it a risky but effective tool against Stalkers.
levelTips.leveltips_greedFourth: Airborne coins can be shot with any hitscan weapon.
levelTips.leveltips_wrathFirst: Falling underwater is slow, but a ground slam allows for a quick return to the ground.
levelTips.leveltips_wrathSecond: Sliding onto water will cause one to skip across its surface.
levelTips.leveltips_wrathThird: If an enemy is blessed by an Idol, a direct visible connection is formed between the two, allowing one to easily track down and destroy the protector.
levelTips.leveltips_wrathFourth2: If an explosion is caused right from where an enemy shoots a projectile, it can backfire and hit them instead.
levelTips.leveltips_heresyFirst1: The space of a large arena can be used to one's advantage.
levelTips.leveltips_heresyFirst2: Using the environment to break line-of-sight with enemies allows for some breathing room and time to consider <color=orange>target prioritization</color>.
levelTips.leveltips_heresySecond2: Dashing needlessly while fighting very aggressive foes will quickly cause one to have none left when it is most needed.
levelTips.leveltips_primeFirst1: Parries can be used as a powerful healing tool.
levelTips.leveltips_primeFirst2: Parrying any enemy projectile or melee attack will fully replenish your health up to the hard damage limit.
levelTips.leveltips_cybergrind: If blown too far off the arena, PUMP CHARGE's overcharge is a good way to get back.
levelTips.leveltips_sandbox1: CHEATS can be enabled in other levels by inputting:

shop.shop_sandboxDescription1: 샌드박스는 연습용으로 쓸 수 있는 빈 레벨입니다.
shop.shop_revolverPiercerDescription1: 보조 발사 버튼을 <color=orange>꾹 누르면</color> 최대 <color=orange>3명의 적을 관통</color>하는 광선을 충전합니다.
shop.shop_revolverMarksmanDescription2: <color=orange>공중에 뜬</color> 동전을 맞추면 탄환이 <color=orange>도탄</color>되어 적의 <color=orange>약점</color>을 맞출 수 있습니다.
shop.shop_shotgunPumpChargeDescription1: 보조 발사 버튼로 산탄총을 <color=orange>펌프질</color>하여, <color=orange>다음 사격</color>의 <color=orange>위력</color>을 늘리고 <color=orange>정확도</color>를 낮출 수 있습니다.
shop.shop_shotgunPumpChargeDescription2: 너무 많이 펌프한 경우 발사 시 <color=orange>폭발</color>할 수 있습니다.
shop.shop_nailgunMagnetDescription1: 보조 발사 버튼을 눌러 근처에 있는 모든 <color=orange>못</color>들을 끌어당기는 <color=orange>자석</color>을 발사할 수 있습니다.
shop.shop_nailgunOverheatDescription1: 발사 중 보조 발사 버튼을 눌러 과열해 <color=orange>방열판</color>을 대가로 짧은 시간 동안 <color=orange>폭발적인</color> 피해를 입힐 수 있습니다.
shop.shop_railcannonScrewdriverDescription1: 적에게 <color=orange>꽃혀</color> 고속으로 회전해 <color=orange>지속 피해</color>를 입히는 강력한 드릴을 발사합니다.
shop.shop_railcannonScrewdriverDescription2: 드릴은 적들을 지속적으로 출혈시키고 더 넓은 회복 반경을 제공합니다.
shop.shop_railcannonMaliciousDescription1: 어딘가 익숙한 얼굴의 빔을 닮은, <color=orange>대폭발</color>을 일으키는 폭발성 광선을 발사합니다.
shop.shop_rocketLauncherFreezeDescription1: 보조 발사 버튼으로 로켓을 제자리에 <color=orange>멈출 수</color> 있습니다.
shop.shop_rocketLauncherFreezeDescription2: 정지된 로켓은 더 큰 폭발 반경을 가지며 다른 무기를 쓸 때도 정지는 <color=orange>지속 시간이 끝날 때까지 유지</color>됩니다.
shop.shop_armFeedbackerDescription2: 산탄총 탄환, 동전을 포함한 다양한 투사체 공격을 받아칠 수 있습니다.
shop.shop_armKnuckleblasterDescription1: 큰 피해량과 넉백을 가진 느린 주먹.
shop.shop_armKnuckleblasterDescription2: 근접 공격 버튼을 꾹 눌러 주먹 속 탄약을 폭발, 주변 적을 쓸어버리는 충격파를 발산할 수 있습니다.
shop.shop_armWhiplashDescription1: 창날이 달린 권양기입니다. 버튼을 눌러서 창을 던지고, 떼서 당기세요.
shop.shop_armWhiplashDescription2: 가벼운 적과 아이템을 당겨올 수 있고, 그래플 포인트와 큰 적에게는 역으로 끌려갑니다.
shop.shop_loreRevolver1: 중장거리 전투를 위해 최후의 전쟁에서 만들어진 무기다. 전기 펄스를 사용하여 미세한 금속 조각을 극도로 빠른 속도로 발사할 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreRevolver2: 이러한 기술을 사용하는 무기를 "전기 무기"라고 불렸고, 기존의 실탄 화기를 대체하는 새로운 표준으로 자리잡았다. 하지만 여전히 미세한 발사체가 필요하기 때문에 탄약은 실제로 무한하지 않지만, 장전된 탄약이 완전히 소진되는 데에는 몇 주가 걸리며, 고철이나 심지어 총의 표면에서 금속 조각을 긁어내는 것만으로도 탄약을 손쉽게 보충할 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreRevolver3: 사실 표면을 긁어서 생긴 거친 표면은 전기 무기를 휘두르는 사용자들에게 있어 자랑스러운 점으로 여겨지는데, 이는 무기가 신뢰성이 높고 오랫동안 사용되었음을 보여주기 때문이다. 때문에 많은 사용자들은 이러한 이유로 총의 탄약을 보충할 때가 아니더라도 굳이 무기의 표면을 깎아내서 "막 출고된" 전기 무기를 개성있게 만들곤 한다.
shop.shop_loreRevolver4: 비록 전기 총은 발사 후 배터리를 충전하는 데 시간이 걸리지만, 리볼버 방식의 디자인은 사격 후 회전하는 다중 배터리 실린더가 탑재됨으로써 각 배터리의 과열 속도를 늦추지 않고 충전하게 만들어 문제를 우회적으로 해결했다.
shop.shop_loreRevolver5: 일반적으로 모든 배터리의 충전을 동시에 해제하여 더 큰 전력을 공급하는 것이 일반적인 개조 사항이지만, 그만큼 충전 시간은 더 길어진다.
shop.shop_loreRevolver6: 언뜻 보기에는 약해 보이지만, 그 힘은 일관성과 단순함에서 나온다고 할 수 있다. 리볼버의 사격은 즉각적인 이동 시간과 어떠한 전투 거리에서도 잘 작동하기 때문에, 빠르게 움직이거나 적의 공격을 회피하면서 사용하기 좋다.
shop.shop_loreRevolver7: 헤드샷은 2배의 피해를 입히며, 팔다리를 맞출 경우 1.5배의 피해를 준다.
shop.shop_loreRevolver8: 마크스맨 변형에서 사용할 수 있는 코인은 빛나는 타이밍에 정확히 명중하면 탄환이 두 발로 쪼개져서 한 번에 두 개의 표적을 맞출 수 있다. 비록 타이밍이 빠듯하지만, 코인이 계속해서 휘파람 소리를 내며 공중에 떠 있는 두 번째 타이밍을 노릴 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreRevolver9: 마크스맨 변형에서 사용할 수 있는 코인은 빛난 이후에 펀치를 하면 코인이 깨지지 않고 가장 가까운 대상에 즉시 적중하여 후속타로 가하는 펀치나 사격의 피해량을 더욱 증가시킬 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreRevolver10: 피어서 변형의 충전 사격 또한 마크스맨 변형의 코인을 적중시킬 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreShotgun1: 고도로 응축된 열을 발사체로 사용하는 실험용 근거리 무기다.
shop.shop_loreShotgun2: 매 사격 마다 샷건의 열을 발생시키는 코어가 과열되어 녹거나 폭발하는 것을 방지하기 위해 냉각시킬 필요가 있다. 이 프로세스는 대부분 자동화되어 있어 사용자가 손목을 한 번 튕기기만 해도 작동된다.
shop.shop_loreShotgun3: 코어가 과열될 경우, 펌프를 수동 열 생성 매커니즘으로 사용할 수 있다. 이 과정은 샷건을 펌프질하는 손잡이 근처의 작은 버튼을 통해 단순화되어 있으나 사용 편의성 또한 사용자가 한 발에 과도한 열을 펌핑함으로써 보고된 불발률을 크게 증가시켰다.
shop.shop_loreShotgun4: 고열 무기는 휘발적 특성과 엄격한 냉각 요건 때문에 전기 무기만큼 큰 인기를 끌지 못했으나, 전기 무기와는 달리 별도의 발사체를 필요하지 않아 실질적으로 탄약이 무한한 것이 아닌, 실제로 무한 탄약인 무기이다.
shop.shop_loreShotgun5: 샷건은 근거리에서만 유효하기 때문에 위험하지만 파괴적인 공격 수단이 될 수 있다. 또한 이것은 회복을 위해 피를 얻을 때 이상적이다.
shop.shop_loreShotgun6: 정확한 타이밍에 적의 몸통을 사격하면 근거리 공격을 튕겨낼 수 있다. 피드배커를 사용하는 것보다 위험하지만 그에 따른 보상으로 더 강력한 피해를 줄 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreShotgun7: 무기를 신속하게 교체하면 사격 후 대기 시간을 생략하여 장시간 가까이 있어야 하는 위험을 감수히면서도 지속적으로 막대한 피해를 줄 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreShotgun8: 코어 이젝트 변형으로 발사한 폭발성 코어는 리볼버와 같은 히트스캔 무기로 맞추면 즉시 폭발함과 동시에 폭발 반경과 피해량이 증가한다. 원래부터 폭발 공격을 다하는 히트스캔 무기를 사용하면 폭발 반경이 대폭 증가한다.
shop.shop_loreShotgun9: 응축된 열 발사체의 속도가 느리다는 것은 단점으로 보일 수 있지만, 이는 적절한 타이밍의 피드배커 펀치가 발사체를 타격할 수 있다는 것을 의미하며 훨씬 더 높은 정확도 및 추가 피해를 위해 자신의 사격을 튕겨서 날려보낼 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreNailgun1: 산업용 네일건과 구식 실탄 무기의 조합으로 탄생한 결과물이다. 대부분의 기계들은 건설 작업용 기계로 만들어졌고, 모든 기계들, 심지어 전쟁을 위해 만들어지지 않은 기계들도 인류의 멸종 이후 스스로 생존하는 법을 배워야 했기 때문이다.
shop.shop_loreNailgun2: 실탄 무기들은 전기 무기, 고열 무기 등의 무한 탄약 시스템이 발명된 후 대부분 버려졌는데, 이는 대규모 군대를 위해 탄약을 사지 않아도 되는 비용이 시간이 지남에 따라 얼마나 저렴해지는가에 대한 것 때문이다.
shop.shop_loreNailgun3: 기존의 탄약 시스템이 그것을 쓸모없게 만들고 대부분 버려지게 되었으나, 이 무기는 여전히 훌륭하게 설계되고 제작되었기 때문에 산업용 네일건의 부품을 일부 개조함으로써 실질적으로 무한한 금속 탄약을 지닌 고속 속사포로 거듭날 수 있었다.
shop.shop_loreNailgun4: 그러나 이 무기가 급조된 무기에서 비롯되었듯이, 그것의 디자인은 완벽과는 거리가 멀다. 못 제조 시스템은 그렇게 빠른 속도로 작동하도록 설계되지 않았기 때문에 고속 제한을 설정하지 않으면 쉽게 과열될 수 있다. 그러나 일부 모델은 내장 히트 싱크를 채택하였다.
shop.shop_loreNailgun5: 제한된 탄약이라는 특성 때문에 네일건은 장시간의 전투보다는 짧은 순간에 폭발적인 화력을 퍼부을 때 효율적이다.
shop.shop_loreNailgun6: 어트랙터 변형에서 사용할 수 있는 자석은 다른 네일건 변형의 못에도 영향을 미치므로 오버히트 변형의 순간 난사같이 명중율이 떨어진다는 단점을 상쇄할 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreNailgun7: 멀리셔스 페이스와 같은 일부 적들은 일반적으로 네일건의 못에 추가 피해를 받으며 특히 어트랙터 변형에서 사용할 수 있는 자석을 사용하면 대부분의 약한 적들을 처치할 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreNailgun8: 적에게 박힌 못은 특수 효과를 받는다. 전기 무기는 못이 박힌 적에게 추가 피해를 가하며 가벼운 적들은 어트랙터의 자석에 의해 당겨져서 체력이 높은 일부 가벼운 적들을 일시적으로 무력화할 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreNailgun9: 총열의 회전 속도는 네일건의 변형들끼리 공유한다. 어트랙터 변형으로 한 번이라도 사격하면 오버히트 변형에 최대치의 열을 제공하여 순간 난사를 쉽게 활용할 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreRailcannon1: 이 산업용 도구는 결국 전기 무기 기술의 초기에 사용된 것들 중 하나였다.
shop.shop_loreRailcannon2: 원래는 휴대용 발전기로써 전쟁이나 탐험 중에 재배치 시 야영지와 같은 임시 이전을 위한 전기를 쉽게 생산하는 용도로 사용되었다.
shop.shop_loreRailcannon3: 대부분의 산업용 도구들과 마찬가지로 인류가 멸종한 이후로 기계들에 의해 무기로 변형되어 낮은 전압의 일정한 출력에서 극도로 높은 위력의 단일 발사를 위한 에너지를 발산하는 용도로 바뀌었다. 때문에 사격 후 긴 재충전 시간을 필요로 한다.
shop.shop_loreRailcannon4: 비록 위험한 무기이지만 충전 시간이 너무 길기 때문에 레일캐논의 힘은 재충전 시간 동안 사용할 수 있는 여러 무기를 휴대하는 사용자에게 사용할 만한 가치가 있는 도구가 된다.
shop.shop_loreRailcannon5: 각 레일캐논의 변형은 서로 다른 용도로 사용되며 모두 동일한 쿨다운을 공유하기 때문에 주어진 상황에서 어떤 레일캐논 변형을 사용할 지 판단하는 능력이 중요하다.
shop.shop_loreRailcannon6: 사격 후 다시 충전되기까지 15초의 시간이 소요된다. 충전율은 HUD의 번개 아이콘으로 표시된다.
shop.shop_loreRailcannon7: 일렉트릭 변형은 마크스맨 리볼버의 코인을 맞출 수 있다. 무한한 관통력을 가졌기 때문에 타이밍과 위치가 좋으면 적을 관통하여 코인을 맞출 수 있고, 코인은 또다시 같은 적에게 리코샷을 날려 단 한번의 사격으로 두 배 높은 피해를 줄 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreRailcannon8: 피드배커 팔을 사용하여 스크류드라이버 변형의 드릴이 부착된 적에게 펀치를 가하면 드릴을 다시 발사하여 추가 피해를 줄 수 있다. 드릴이 또 다른 적에게 적중하면 타이머가 재설정되는데, 이는 드릴이 두 적 사이에 거의 무한한 저글링을 할 수 있다는 것을 의미하지만, 드릴이 붙어 있는 적이 죽으면 부러진다.
shop.shop_loreRailcannon9: 멀리셔스 변형은 코어 이젝트 샷건으로 발사한 폭발성 코어를 공중에서 맞춰 폭발 범위와 데미지를 매우 크게 높일 수 있다. 빗나가게 되면 레일캐논의 사격을 낭비하고 15초를 더 기다려야 하기 때문에 난이도가 높은 기술이지만, 그에 따른 보상이 크다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher1: 산업용 도구로 사용되었던 이 무기는 탄환 계열 무기인 리볼버, 샷건, 네일건에 비해 레일캐논의 것처럼 개성적인 색상을 가졌다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher2: 대부분의 진보된 기술들과 마찬가지로 원래는 전쟁용을 목적으로 만들어졌다. 가령 이 폭발물 생성 시스템같은 경우는 참호를 파거나, 장애물을 파괴하거나, 폭발성 무기를 재보급하는 데 요긴하게 사용되었다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher3: 그러나 이 도구 자체는 발사기로 사용할 수 없었다. 초기 생산품들은 생성기와 발사기 두 가지가 결합된 형태였으나 폭발물을 기폭하는 시스템을 포함해 생산 과정에서 종종 우발적인 화학 반응을 일으켜 폭발물이 채 완성되기도 전에 폭발하는 사고가 빈번했기 떄문이다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher4: 그 이후로, 발사 과정은 폭발물 생성기가 로켓의 나머지 부분을 제조하고 로켓 발사기가 기폭 매커니즘을 적용하는 생성 장치와 별도의 로켓 발사기 사이에 과정이 둘로 분할되었다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher5: 기계들이 다른 사람들과 피를 나누는 것은 낭비로 여겨졌기 때문에 협력의 사치가 거의 없었다. 이 무기를 만든 기계는 대신 한 명의 사용자와 함께 작동하도록 제조 과정을 수정했고, 투사체를 발사하기 위한 잭해머의 부품을 용도 변경했다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher6: 따라서 일반적인 폭발 유발 매커니즘을 사용하지 않고, 로켓은 화학 반응을 완료하기 위해 대상의 혈액을 대신 사용하여 생성 과정을 안전하게 만들었다. 따라서 이 무기로 피해를 입히기 위해서는 직격으로 맞출 필요가 있기 때문에, 사용이 어렵다고 할 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher7: 제대로 된 사용에 필요한 기술은 그것을 압도하게 만들지만, 위력은 그것을 보완하는 것 이상으로 강력하다. 그리고 로켓 런처를 휘두르는 사용자들은 그것을 그들만의 사격 기술의 상징으로 채택하기로 했다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher8: 로켓은 오직 살아있는 목표물을 직격으로 맞출 때에만 데미지를 주고 폭발을 일으키지만, 로켓이 적을 타격하지 않고 지면에 맞으면 적을 공중으로 띄울 수 있다. 공중에서 떨어지는 적을 직격으로 맞추면 더 크고 강력한 피해를 주는 폭발을 일으킬 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher9: 로켓 발사기는 꺼낸 후 대기 시간을 거의 필요로 하지 않는다. 즉, 다른 무기들과의 콤보를 이어가는 과정에서 신속하게 추가 피해를 주기 위해 빠르게 꺼내 쏜 다음 다시 다른 무기로 꺼내 대응할 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher10: 로켓은 어트랙터 변형의 자석에 이끌리지만 유도되는 힘이 다소 떨어진다. 프리즈프레임 변형을 사용하면 유도탄의 정확도를 향상시킬 수 있다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher11: 로켓을 위플래시로 잡으면 로켓은 추진을 멈추고 사용자를 향해 끌어당겨진다. 위플래시로 잡은 로켓이 다른 적들과 충돌하지 않는 이상, 사용자와 충돌할 때 폭발을 일으키고 뒤로 밀려난다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher12: 가벼운 적들은 위플래시에 의해 당겨질 때 공중에 뜨기 때문에 공중 직격을 위해 유용하게 사용할 수 있다. 그러나 사용자가 폭발의 증가된 반경을 피하려면 목표물로부터 멀리 떨어진 상태여야 한다.
shop.shop_loreRocketLauncher13: V1을 비롯한 몇몇 가벼운 기계들은 로켓 위에 올라탈 수 있다. 이것은 프리즈프레임 변형으로 로켓을 멈춘 후 그 위로 점프하면 쉽게 할 수 있다. 비록 낮은 무게에도 불구하고 로켓 위에 올라타면 시간이 지나면서 점차 추진력을 잃고 떨어지게 되지만, 물 속에서의 V1은 이러한 낙하를 야기하지 않을 만큼 충분히 가볍다.

cheats.cheats_disclaimer1: Enabling cheats means you will not gain a rank upon completion of a level and a Cyber Grind high score will not be saved.
cheats.cheats_disclaimer2: Press ~ or HOME after enabling cheats to toggle to menu.

enemybios.enemyBios_filth_1: Husks are physical manifestations of the souls of the damned.
enemybios.enemyBios_filth_2: The physical form is based on the value of the original soul, which is determined by the strength of its will and its prevalence in public consciousness: the living souls that remember it.
enemybios.enemyBios_filth_3: Filth are the lowest form of Husk, whose souls were too weak and unimportant to even form a complete physical body.
enemybios.enemyBios_filth_4: Even among Husks, they have the lowest intelligence, driven purely by hunger.
enemybios.enemyBios_filth_strategy1: Most weapons are easily capable of taking down Filth, but their powerful jaws and sheer numbers can overwhelm a target quickly if underestimated.
enemybios.enemyBios_filth_strategy2: Explosives are the most effective way to take down swarms, but any weapon that can hit more than one target will be efficient.
enemybios.enemyBios_stray_1: While their tall stature may seem intimidating, Strays are afraid of most danger and will try to stay at a safe distance, only attacking via projectiles formed with Hell Energy.
enemybios.enemyBios_stray_2: Although controlling and manifesting this energy is a complicated task, Strays have very low intelligence and are only able to do so via pure instinct.
enemybios.enemyBios_stray_3: Nevertheless, humans were unable to replicate this level of accuracy and control, particularly the Stray's ability to cause the energy orbs to selectively ignore other Husks.
enemybios.enemyBios_stray_strategy1: Most weapons will be effective against them, but a Revolver headshot is the quickest and surest way to eliminate a Stray.
enemybios.enemyBios_stray_strategy2: Due to their static nature and slow rate of attacking, they are an excellent target for projectile parrying.
enemybios.enemyBios_schism_1: The result of two souls attempting to manifest in the same space, causing an amalgamation of two physical bodies.
enemybios.enemyBios_schism_2: Due to the doubled body mass, they're quite resilient to damage, but have very poor motor control and thus cannot aim with any degree of accuracy, resorting to barrages of energy orbs in the general direction of their opponent.
enemybios.enemyBios_schism_strategy1: Piercer revolver's charged headshots are an efficient tool for a quick kill against Schisms, though their displaced head can make aiming difficult for the inexperienced.
enemybios.enemyBios_schism_strategy2: A point-blank Pump Charge shotgun blast with 2 pumps will be able to take them down in a single shot.
enemybios.enemyBios_schism_strategy3: Due to their poor aim, they aren't a priority target, but the sheer amount of projectiles can sometimes make avoiding them tricky in busy encounters.
enemybios.enemyBios_soldier_1: Soldiers are an augmented version of Strays, whose technological implants have been scavenged from broken machines to channel Hell Energy with greater efficiency.
enemybios.enemyBios_soldier_2: This increase in power gives Soldiers more self-confidence, causing them to act more aggressively than normal Strays.
enemybios.enemyBios_soldier_3: Despite the enhancements, their intelligence remains low and it has yet to be determined who or what actually augmented them.
enemybios.enemyBios_soldier_strategy1: The shotgun is an excellent weapon against Soldiers, as long as its use is swift so as to not allow them to protect themselves with melee attacks.
enemybios.enemyBios_soldier_strategy2: Since Soldiers charge their shots in front of them rather than above them, the charge is also easier to interrupt via a precise revolver shot for an explosive kill.
enemybios.enemyBios_soldier_strategy3: Thanks to their augmentations, Soldiers are able to withstand normal explosions with little to no damage. The more powerful red explosions will go through their guard however, and they are unable to block if not on the ground.
enemybios.enemyBios_ferryman_1: Ferrymen are rare husks whose powerful bodies, trained skills and blind faith have granted them the chance of becoming the transporters of souls between the layers of Hell.
enemybios.enemyBios_ferryman_2: They have each been given a holy cloth by Heaven as a symbol of their devotion to God's order, which they wear over their bodies to hide the human form that they've grown to despise as a reminder of their sins in life stopping them from becoming angels.
enemybios.enemyBios_ferryman_3: Due to the holy power emanating from the cloth, Ferrymen's skeletal bodies have slowly been colored bright and radiant, and their skulls have enough latent energy to open gates that otherwise stop Husks from exiting their places of torment.
enemybios.enemyBios_ferryman_4: Each ferry can only have one Ferryman at a time, so when a new Ferryman is formed, it will fight another to the death in order to take their place and inherit their cloth. The loser's skull is taken as a trophy and used to grant the winner passage across the layers in order to transport the souls of the damned to their destinations.
enemybios.enemyBios_ferryman_5: Ferrymen will often use the knowledge from their past life to improve their ferries, growing past the need for oars, which are now used by Ferrymen only as weapons.
enemybios.enemyBios_ferryman_6: As the influx of souls has ended with the death of mankind, the Ferrymen have lost their purpose and now wander around aimlessly, hoping that the angels would grant them passage into Heaven, despite Gabriel being the only one who cares about their efforts.
enemybios.enemyBios_ferryman_strategy1: Ferrymen choose their attacks based on their opponent's actions. When approached, they move to safety, and when retreated from, they'll apply pressure via attacks with greater reach.
enemybios.enemyBios_ferryman_strategy2: Despite its looks, their uppercut is quite dangerous and can be difficult to dodge. It's best not to stay in the air for too long.
enemybios.enemyBios_ferryman_strategy3: Some of their attacks are parryable and some are not. Pay attention to the color of their warning flash to learn which are which.
enemybios.enemyBios_ferryman_strategy4: Ferrymen may attempt to cross a retreating opponent up by rolling behind them before attacking. Keep track of their position and if they roll too often, try being more aggressive.
enemybios.enemyBios_idol_1: Although they can easily be mistaken to be of divine origin, Idols were created using the same process as other demons. Unlike their larger kin, their shells were too small to contain a useful amount of Hell Mass, creating life, but leaving it unable to move or act.
enemybios.enemyBios_idol_2: The Idols did not originally look divine, but were painstakingly carved to such shapes by Ferrymen who collected them during travels across the layers of Hell. This was done as both an act of compassion and as a tribute to angels, particularly Gabriel, whom Ferrymen believe to have similarly granted them mercy.
enemybios.enemyBios_idol_3: Close proximity to a Ferryman's holy cloth during the long and arduous carving process caused its holy power to seep into them, allowing them to continue the chain of compassion by protecting others from physical harm.
enemybios.enemyBios_idol_4: It is fortunate for them that Gabriel is the only angel of Heaven's higher order to watch over Hell, since if the Council had found out about such beings, they would have been labelled perversions of the divine form and ordered to be destroyed by the Ferrymen who so lovingly had granted them a chance at life.
enemybios.enemyBios_idol_strategy1: Although Idols are immune to projectiles, they can be destroyed by a blunt force melee attack such as a punch or a ground slam.
enemybios.enemyBios_idol_strategy2: Blessed enemies cannot be damaged by attacks, but will still be pushed by physical forces and can be killed by environmental dangers, such as crushers or fans.
enemybios.enemyBios_idol_strategy3: Neither Idols nor blessed enemies can be grappled onto with the Whiplash.
enemybios.enemyBios_leviathan_1: Unlike most demons, the Leviathan is not formed from generic Hell Mass, but instead from the bodies of the Sullen, a name used for those in the Ocean Styx who have given up fighting for air and instead lay at the bottom of the ocean, drowning eternally.
enemybios.enemyBios_leviathan_2: The Sullen, in their motionlessness, were eventually fused together by the same force that created the other demons, becoming the biblical Leviathan, an abomination prophesized to be at the end of the world.
enemybios.enemyBios_leviathan_3: The heart, which houses the souls of the Sullen in endless anguish as their flesh, veins and nerves writhe and mutate, attempted to escape its body, but Gabriel struck it down with his divine spears, pinning it back onto its head, unable to move.
enemybios.enemyBios_leviathan_4: Although the world ended, the Leviathan remains trapped in the Ocean Styx, growing ever longer as more of Wrath's sinners give up and sink to the bottom.
enemybios.enemyBios_leviathan_strategy1: The Leviathan's heart is exposed on top of its head, making it a clear weakpoint to aim for. Although it's usually not visible, it can be seen after the Leviathan's attacks, opening an opportunity for direct damage, or for landing a magnet.
enemybios.enemyBios_leviathan_strategy2: Although ill-advised, it is possible to ride the Leviathan for a short period of time. A well-timed jump will allow one to dodge the Leviathan's bite attack as well as land on its head near its exposed heart.
enemybios.enemyBios_leviathan_strategy3: The tail will either swing high or low, and the height of the swing can be determined by the direction in which the swing rotates.
enemybios.enemyBios_corpseOfKingMinos_1: Once the great and beloved king of the Lust layer, Minos has now been reduced to a shambling corpse.
enemybios.enemyBios_corpseOfKingMinos_2: Due to his incredible power of will and status as a just ruler in life remembered even millennia after his death, the manifestation of his soul is the largest Husk to ever have been recorded.
enemybios.enemyBios_corpseOfKingMinos_3: Small traces of the original soul can still be detected in the body, but the corpse itself is animated and controlled entirely by the snakelike Parasites that he once commanded.
enemybios.enemyBios_corpseOfKingMinos_4: Despite once bringing upon the renaissance of the Lust layer, his corpse now only seeks sinners to punish.
enemybios.enemyBios_corpseOfKingMinos_strategy1: Due to his large stature, it can be quite difficult to recover blood from him, but his hands are usually holding on to the walls of the arena, which can be used for refueling.
enemybios.enemyBios_corpseOfKingMinos_strategy2: Any weapon will work against an enemy this large, but melee and projectile parries make for a quick way to inflict grave damage.
enemybios.enemyBios_corpseOfKingMinos_strategy3: Although it moves slowly, the Black Hole he summons is extremely dangerous and cannot be destroyed.
enemybios.enemyBios_stalker_1: As the Greed layer's punishment, Stalkers have been forced to carry heavy boulders up the monuments of mankind's greed for all eternity.
enemybios.enemyBios_stalker_2: They have carried out their punishment for so long that their bodies have evolved, warped and grown to better suit it.
enemybios.enemyBios_stalker_3: Their limbs have twisted to give them better balance while carrying boulders on their backs and their skin and muscles have completely dried up, allowing them to survive direct contact with the dunes of gold dust that Greed's sun has raised to unfathomably high temperatures.
enemybios.enemyBios_stalker_4: However, an unidentified sentient force has replaced the boulders they would normally carry with high tech bombs that, upon detonation, will transform any nearby blood into the gold dust "sand" that covers the layer's surface.
enemybios.enemyBios_stalker_5: Research has shown the technology to be very similar to the augmentations of the modified Strays known as Soldiers, so it is likely both modifications come from the same source.
enemybios.enemyBios_stalker_strategy1: The lights on the canister give information on a Stalker's state. The color shows the state of their explosive and the brightness of the color shows how much health the Stalker has left.
enemybios.enemyBios_stalker_strategy2: It's advisable to forcibly detonate a Stalker rather than allowing one to detonate itself, as the latter explosion will have a larger area of effect.
enemybios.enemyBios_stalker_strategy3: If a Stalker gets close to its target and can no longer be pushed away, a ground slam wave can launch them out of range so they can be detonated safely in mid-air, since the explosion is mostly horizontal.
enemybios.enemyBios_stalker_strategy4: Attaching magnets to a Stalker will reduce the radius of its detonation.
enemybios.enemyBios_insurrectionist_1: The Sisyphean Insurrectionists were an army of Husks gathered and trained by King Sisyphus for overthrowing Heaven's control of Hell, freeing the sinners from their eternal torment.
enemybios.enemyBios_insurrectionist_2: During an era of chaos in Heaven, as the angelic watch was absent, Sisyphus began setting his plan in motion as his forces recruited all Husks that were intelligent enough to be useful to their cause and began attacking the demons that wandered the dunes of Greed.
enemybios.enemyBios_insurrectionist_3: Upon the establishment of the Council and subsequent return of peace to Heaven, Gabriel and an army of angels were sent down to crush the insurrection and subjugate Sisyphus' army.
enemybios.enemyBios_insurrectionist_4: Although their battle was well-fought, the inexperienced Insurrectionists could not match the educated strategy of the angels, who quickly descended upon King Sisyphus with great force, eventually overpowering and killing him, leaving the Insurrectionists without a chain of command.
enemybios.enemyBios_insurrectionist_5: Left scattered and disoriented, the warriors were easily picked off one by one, their bodies cut apart, leaving behind only the bare essentials required to carry on their eternal punishment of hauling heavy boulders up the monuments of mankind's arrogance and greed.
enemybios.enemyBios_insurrectionist_6: Although the blood of their enemies still stains their bodies and their grasp still clutches their fallen foes, their will and fierce fury only serve as mental torment in knowing how close they were to freedom.
enemybios.enemyBios_insurrectionist_strategy1: The Sisyphean Insurrectionists soak their feet in the blood of their enemies to protect them from the heat of Greed's dunes, but the rest of their body is still skin and flesh, which can be set aflame to greatly weaken their defences, increasing the damage of any attack dealt to them.
enemybios.enemyBios_insurrectionist_strategy2: Though they have practically unlimited range, each of the Insurrectionist's swings has strengths and weaknesses. Learning which way to dodge to avoid each attack is vital.
enemybios.enemyBios_insurrectionist_strategy3: The Insurrectionist's stomp is fast and destructive, so it's inadvisable to stay close for long.
enemybios.enemyBios_insurrectionist_strategy4: The Malicious Face they wield as a weapon is not a part of their body, so hitting it will not deal damage to an Insurrectionist, but this also means that it can still be used to heal even if its wielder's blood has been turned to sand.
enemybios.enemyBios_swordsmachine_1: Its original form is unrecognisable after years of scavenging scrap and rebuilding itself, but among scrapheads, the Swordsmachine is quite famous due to its combat prowess and selfmade form, ugly to most but beautiful to enthusiasts, spawning many copycats.
enemybios.enemyBios_swordsmachine_2: It wields a selfmade sword with a motor on it that, when revved, will heat the blade, cutting through most organic matter with ease.
enemybios.enemyBios_swordsmachine_3: Due to its possessive hoarding behavior, it's one of the few machines still capable of vocalization -- an ability most have discarded for more efficient resource management.
enemybios.enemyBios_swordsmachine_strategy1: Despite its excellent performance against Hell's denizens, its design does not take into account extremely mobile opponents, so the best way to avoid its blade is to jump out of its vertical range.
enemybios.enemyBios_swordsmachine_strategy2: Its motorized sword makes for predictable attacks, making the Swordsmachine an excellent target for parrying.
enemybios.enemyBios_swordsmachine_strategy3: Although its use of ranged weapons is primitive at best, its sword throws can be unexpectedly accurate thanks to its mastery of the weapon.
enemybios.enemyBios_drone_1: A mass-produced security device built as both a surveillance camera and a security guard.
enemybios.enemyBios_drone_2: Though originally built to only use non-lethal ammunition, they have scavenged parts from the defunct machines on the surface for greater efficiency at collecting blood.
enemybios.enemyBios_drone_3: Curious by nature, but to keep production costs low, their intelligence is very limited.
enemybios.enemyBios_drone_strategy1: Due to their light weight, physical projectiles such as nails will push them around, making them harder to deal consistent damage to.
enemybios.enemyBios_drone_strategy2: On death they will make a last ditch effort to harm their opponent with a self-destruct, but powerful single attacks and explosives will make them explode instantly.
enemybios.enemyBios_drone_strategy3: Punching a drone will redirect their suicide dive, making them a high-risk offensive opportunity.
enemybios.enemyBios_drone_strategy4: Their scanning mechanism makes a chirping sound, which can be listened for to make them easier to track down, as their flight and small size can lead them to hard to reach places.
enemybios.enemyBios_streetcleaner_1: Originally built as a way to purify the tainted air of cities after the climate catastrophe, Streetcleaners were made obsolete during the New Peace, and were repurposed as scouts for Hell expeditions.
enemybios.enemyBios_streetcleaner_2: However, their urge to clean remained, and after the fall of mankind, they began burning any organic matter they came across in an effort to purify the world.
enemybios.enemyBios_streetcleaner_strategy1: Due to their combat experience, they can be tricky to take down with projectiles or explosives.
enemybios.enemyBios_streetcleaner_strategy2: The canister on their back is a major weakpoint that can be shattered with a precision shot, such as a Marksman coin ricochet from behind.
enemybios.enemyBios_streetcleaner_strategy3: Point-blank attacks can also be very efficient, but must be performed quickly to avoid the fire of their flamethrowers.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2_1: The V model was built for war, with V1 boasting a new kind of exterior plating that allowed refueling through contact with blood rather than through a separate blood refueling process.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2_2: Due to its necessary thinness, it is far less durable, but the ability to fix itself and rebuild broken parts on the fly would outweigh the negatives on an active battlefield.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2_3: However, during the prototyping phase, the New Peace was established and war became irrelevant.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2_4: V1's planned production was cancelled and an updated model, V2, was developed instead, using the standardized plating, since durability was far more important during times of peace when no bloodshed was necessary.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2_5: Neither model ever reached mass production due to the end of wars completely draining any demand, so it's likely only a single prototype build of each model remains in existence.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2_strategy1: V2 is adept at controlling space and will take advantage of this to change the flow of battle to throw off its opponent. Stay too close and it will run away. Stay far away and it will come close.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2_strategy2: V2's high mobility makes it a tricky target to hit, and especially difficult to heal off of. When in need of blood and unable to catch up, it's instead recommended to stay away from it and let it come to you instead.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2_strategy3: V2 will switch weapons depending on the distance from its target, so if one of its weapons is difficult to avoid, a change in proximity will close it off.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2_strategy4: Knowledge of the synergies of one's own arsenal can allow one to turn V2's weapons against it.
enemybios.enemyBios_mindflayer_1: Rare but extremely dangerous, the Mindflayer is a machine that has adapted and mastered the use of Hell Energy alongside its own technological prowess.
enemybios.enemyBios_mindflayer_2: The machine itself is only the top part of its apparent body, the rest of which is a plastic shell in the form of a human, which they seem to have built themselves.
enemybios.enemyBios_mindflayer_3: The plastic body serves no function and is only for aesthetic purposes.
enemybios.enemyBios_mindflayer_4: Despite it being a waste of resources, Mindflayers will use everything in its power to protect the plastic body from harm, even if that means destroying itself in the process.
enemybios.enemyBios_mindflayer_5: Mindflayers seem to prefer a female form, though very rare occasions of male forms have also been recorded.
enemybios.enemyBios_mindflayer_strategy1: When encountering a Mindflayer, it's imperative to keep track of their actions either through visuals or audio.
enemybios.enemyBios_mindflayer_strategy2: Due to their homing projectiles being fired in a burst, a safe explosive such as a Knuckleblaster blastwave is the most efficient in deflecting them.
enemybios.enemyBios_mindflayer_strategy3: Their instant teleportation can make consistent positional advantage quite difficult, but a Screwdriver drill will temporarily stop them from teleporting.
enemybios.enemyBios_sentry_1: One of the many war machines created during the Final War. Although there were attempts to find new purpose for them during the New Peace, their streamlined design made them unable to be repurposed until the start of the Hell expeditions.
enemybios.enemyBios_sentry_2: Their extremely powerful legs and feet allow them to dig into the ground, making them immovable by most forces and allowing them to easily line up any shot without interruption.
enemybios.enemyBios_sentry_3: Despite their size, they were built to be extremely light, which when combined with the power of their legs, allows them to move at extremely fast speeds. Such power and lightness have made their legs one of the most sought after parts by scrapheads.
enemybios.enemyBios_sentry_4: Most machines will only render a simplified approximation of their visual surroundings for faster processing speed, but Sentries use full renders instead, giving them perfect accuracy even over extremely long distances.
enemybios.enemyBios_sentry_strategy1: Due to their powerful legs, once they've dug into the ground to aim, they can no longer move.
enemybios.enemyBios_sentry_strategy2: Once dug in, the only ways to interrupt their attack are: Shooting them with the Electric Railcannon, hitting their antenna with the Revolver, launching them with the ground slam wave or punching them with the Knuckleblaster.
enemybios.enemyBios_sentry_strategy3: As long as they haven't dug in, their light weight makes them easy to launch and keep in the air where they are harmless.
enemybios.enemyBios_sentry_strategy4: A good way to disable a Sentry for a longer period of time is to shoot nails into them with the Nailgun and then placing a magnet in a nearby wall or ceiling, which will pull them once they've been knocked off balance.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2Second_1: After its defeat and escape, V2 dove deeper into Hell, killing other machines for their blood to help its recovery with the intent of taking revenge on V1 and recovering its original arm.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2Second_2: After finding a temporary replacement from one of its victims, V2 used parts from other machines to transform the new placeholder arm into a mobility tool that would allow it to catch up to V1's fast descent into the deeper layers.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2Second_3: In order to prepare for their second and final encounter, it researched the combat data from their previous battle to copy strategies and techniques from the older and more experienced V1 to give itself an upper hand.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2Second_4: However, despite all its preparation, V2 lost again, and unable to escape this time, was brought to a swift and decisive end by its predecessor.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2Second_strategy1: Although V2's coins may seem extremely dangerous at first, they are also an excellent opportunity for high damage if shot before V2 can.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2Second_strategy2: V2's nailgun can be circumvented or turned against itself via Magnets.
enemybios.enemyBios_v2Second_strategy3: Hitting V2 with its own arm will cause it to enrage instantly.
enemybios.enemyBios_maliciousFace_1: Demons are creatures born from the mass of Hell. They are most easily recognisable by their hard stone-like exterior and slow movement.
enemybios.enemyBios_maliciousFace_2: Demons have higher intelligence than Husks, but are still incapable of rational thought and communication. No demons have been able to pass the mirror test, though studies are limited due to their hostility.
enemybios.enemyBios_maliciousFace_3: Malicious Faces are the most common type of demon, but are incredibly dangerous, especially in swarms, due to their mastery of the use of Hell Energy as a weapon.
enemybios.enemyBios_maliciousFace_strategy1: Due to their burst fire, they can be quite difficult to get close to, so despite the effectiveness of a point blank shotgun shot, nails are the recommended course of action, with magnets enabling long-range combat.
enemybios.enemyBios_maliciousFace_strategy2: Due to their invulnerability to explosions, they don't need to hold back the energy of their beam attacks, so staying away from walls and other surfaces is recommended when they begin charging an energy beam.
enemybios.enemyBios_cerberus_1: Although they do not resemble the mythological three-headed dog, this name was chosen due to their nature as protectors of Hell. However, it's not yet known why some stay dormant despite provocation.
enemybios.enemyBios_cerberus_2: Despite the fact that keeping an energy orb stable takes a considerable amount of focus and effort, they seem to always keep one in hand, most likely as a display of their power to scare off intruders.
enemybios.enemyBios_cerberus_strategy1: Due to remaining entirely stationary until awoken, they move quite slowly, so engagement distance is easy to control.
enemybios.enemyBios_cerberus_strategy2: They're quite adept at ranged combat by throwing their orb, but in order to avoid damaging themselves, they will not initiate a throw while their target is close, which can be used to manipulate their behavior, though once a throw has started, it cannot be stopped.
enemybios.enemyBios_cerberus_strategy3: Due to the extreme concentration of their energy orbs, thrown ones explode on physical impact, so staying close to surfaces such the floor or any walls will make avoiding ranged attacks more difficult.
enemybios.enemyBios_hideousMass_1: Hideous Masses are a rare occurrence, when an excessive amount of Hell Mass is poured into a single shell, causing it to overflow and burst at the seams.
enemybios.enemyBios_hideousMass_2: Due to the broken seams allowing for mobility without having to bend the exterior, the stone has hardened more than the shell of most demons, making it completely impervious to all currently known attacks.
enemybios.enemyBios_hideousMass_strategy1: Although its stone exterior makes for an impenetrable defense, the Hideous Mass' belly and tail remain exposed and vulnerable.
enemybios.enemyBios_hideousMass_strategy2: While standing up, a quick burst of close range damage is the most effective way to hurt them, though this will most likely cause it to change formations, so being quick and decisive is the key.
enemybios.enemyBios_hideousMass_strategy3: When in its low formation, keeping a safe distance is recommended due to its melee capabilities and high speed tail harpoon, though the brave or suicidal may attempt to climb on its back to continue dealing close range damage to the tail.
enemybios.enemyBios_hideousMass_strategy4: When caught by the harpoon, it's recommendable to either punch the harpoon or damage the tail to remove it.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabriel_1: One of the most respected and feared archangels, Gabriel earned his reputation through power and efficiency.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabriel_2: Regardless of the task given, Gabriel would always perform it quickly and decisively, earning him the title of Judge of Hell after dethroning Minos and ending the Lust renaissance.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabriel_3: Despite answering to the Council, he is far more popular and beloved among angels due to his radiant personality and active nature, especially compared to the Council that strictly follows and upholds the dogma of the Faith.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabriel_strategy1: Gabriel's movements are fast and his attacks are deadly, but by observing which weapon he manifests, his attacks can be accurately predicted before he even starts them.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabriel_strategy2: Gabriel's pride stops him from attacking while taunting his opponent, opening up a short window for healing.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabrielSecond_1: Having twice clashed with the machine and lost, Gabriel realized he had been mistaken. The strong fire that burned inside him was not hatred at all, but passion.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabrielSecond_2: Gabriel had never before known the joy of a struggle, of coming face-to-face with an opponent of equal or greater measure. Though he had lost twice, each loss only further grew his desire to overcome.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabrielSecond_3: Up until now, he had only done what was expected of him, but now for the first time he had found something he himself wanted. Not even the fast encroaching End of Hell mattered to him anymore.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabrielSecond_4: Still, having come to realize the horrors he had committed in God's name, he felt a great guilt. Though he could not undo what he had done, Gabriel knew he had to make things right, and headed to Hell for the last time.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabrielSecond_strategy1: While Gabriel's speed has increased, his accuracy has not. Dodging diagonally or to the side will prove more fruitful than trying to run backwards out of the range of his swords.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabrielSecond_strategy2: Though his sword throw may seem impossible to dodge, it will prove an excellent weapon if parried instead.
enemybios.enemyBios_gabrielSecond_strategy3: Overcome with emotion, Gabriel will sometimes stop to taunt his opponent, creating a window for healing.
enemybios.enemyBios_virtue_1: The basis of a lesser angel's forming are quite similar to that of the Husks', wherein the physical manifestation of the soul is dependant on its value, though unlike for Husks, virtuousness also acts as a factor for angels.
enemybios.enemyBios_virtue_2: Lesser angels come from human souls, which are formed into abstract or animalistic shapes, making them distinct from the humanoid bodies of greater and supreme angels, who were created as such and are considered purer and placed higher on Heaven's societal hierarchy.
enemybios.enemyBios_virtue_3: Due to their past lives as humans, Virtues are often sent to complete tasks that greater angels deem below them or otherwise uninteresting, such as acting as wardens in Hell. There Virtues use heavenly fire to punish sinners who aren't acting out their punishment, in order to not waste Gabriel's time with minor offences and fluctuations.
enemybios.enemyBios_virtue_4: Virtues are normally known to have a multitude of eyes, though for unknown reasons, these eyes are hidden or removed for ones that become wardens in Hell. Some have speculated this may be related to why almost all husks lack eyes, with the only verified exception being the previous Judge of Hell, King Minos.
enemybios.enemyBios_virtue_5: Little is known about the specifics of angels, as Heaven is exclusionary and segregated due to wanting little to no direct contact with God's human experiment.
enemybios.enemyBios_virtue_strategy1: Verticality and cover give little safety against the Virtue's light beams, so constant horizontal movement is encouraged, though retracing one's steps can be dangerous as the beams linger.
enemybios.enemyBios_virtue_strategy2: If ignored for too long, Virtues will enrage, making their light beams predict their target's movement. Although it's easy to avoid their attacks with enough space, leaving them unattended can quickly turn the tables in their favor
enemybios.enemyBios_somethingWicked_1: Very little is known about this creature.
enemybios.enemyBios_somethingWicked_2: Some speculate it to be a Husk, but due to its elusive and extremely hostile nature, no one has been able to confirm the hypothesis.
enemybios.enemyBios_somethingWicked_3: Only one has ever been observed and it has never been seen leaving the section of the Mouth of Hell in which it currently resides.
enemybios.enemyBios_somethingWicked_strategy1: Any attack will temporarily cause it to relocate, but there are no known ways to kill it.
enemybios.enemyBios_somethingWicked_strategy2: Its way of attacking is unknown outside of the fact that it happens on physical contact, but no amount of protection has saved any of its victims.
enemybios.enemyBios_fleshPrison_1: Flesh Prison is an uncategorized organism created by the angels to imprison Minos' soul after he was slain by Gabriel.
enemybios.enemyBios_fleshPrison_2: Although it is similar to Husks, it does not possess a soul or any amount of thought. All of its actions are purely predetermined reactions to stimulus, making it more of an organic machine than a living being.
enemybios.enemyBios_fleshPrison_3: In order to make it as impenetrable as possible, it was given both divine power and hell energy, which makes its attacks erratic and chaotic.
enemybios.enemyBios_fleshPrison_strategy1: Flesh Prison will use its spawn to heal its own wounds. The more spawn are left, the more likely it is for Flesh Prison to attempt to heal its wounds, so it's advisable to avoid damaging it until the spawn are dead.
enemybios.enemyBios_fleshPrison_strategy2: The long window of a delayed split shot timing makes for a great way to clear out multiple spawn at once. Throwing multiple coins high into the air and waiting for them to reach the delayed split shot state before shooting them is a strong opening move after Flesh Prison creates its spawn.
enemybios.enemyBios_minosPrime_1: A prime soul is an incredibly rare occurrence in which a soul amasses so much power that it no longer requires a Husk as a vessel to manifest physically.
enemybios.enemyBios_minosPrime_2: As manifestations of pure will, prime souls are incredibly powerful, to the point that even the prideful angels see them as a threat and will use any means necessary to stop them from forming.
enemybios.enemyBios_minosPrime_3: King Minos felt that eternal suffering was an unfair and unreasonable punishment for those whose only sin was loving another. After the Disappearance of God, as angels were lost and Heaven was in chaos, Minos began his efforts to reform the Lust layer.
enemybios.enemyBios_minosPrime_4: The Lust renaissance was prosperous, as King Minos guided its inhabitants to come together and build a new civilization. The combined efforts of the countless who had been damned to the second layer bore great results as the grand city of Lust grew and grew.
enemybios.enemyBios_minosPrime_5: However, after the Council took control of Heaven and brought stability to it through their iron fist rule, they saw that Minos had gone against God's will by freeing sinners from the punishment that God had designed for them.
enemybios.enemyBios_minosPrime_6: Gabriel, the brightest of the angels, was sent to kill Minos. The king, rather than fight back, tried to reason with him, but Gabriel mercilessly struck him down without listening.
enemybios.enemyBios_minosPrime_7: As Minos' will was strong enough to attempt to stand up to Heaven's rule, the angels chose to imprison his soul in an attempt to stop it from forming into a prime soul and appointed Gabriel as the new Judge of Hell.
enemybios.enemyBios_minosPrime_8: From the prison inside his own body, Minos helplessly watched as his soulless corpse, now controlled by parasites, tore apart everything he had worked so hard to build, cursing his own weakness for failing to protect his people, vowing to take revenge...
enemybios.enemyBios_minosPrime_strategy1: It's rare for Minos Prime to give a window of opportunity to heal, so it's vital to learn what attacks leave him momentarily vulnerable and how to dodge them in a way that gives an advantageous position during those moments.
enemybios.enemyBios_minosPrime_strategy2: His snake projectiles can be parried using the Feedbacker for a full heal, even if the projectile doesn't hit Minos Prime.

primeSanctum.primeSanctum_first_secretText2: INTRODUCTION TO TERMINALS (DRAFT! DO NOT SEND!! // todo: ADD PICTURES SO THOSE FUCKING SUITS DON'T FALL ASLEEP LIKE LAST TIME)
primeSanctum.primeSanctum_first_secretText3: The elevator room terminals are an advanced interconnected network built for the purpose of transferring materials and tools between different areas. They are capable of transferring physical material as information across a radio signal, which other terminals can receive and use to reconstruct the sent object. The original item is lost, as it is transformed into the energy that is used to transmit the material information, and the process is quite slow due to the amount of information that physical matter holds.
primeSanctum.primeSanctum_first_secretText4: An early test of a matter transfer's accuracy was a mint condition 78rpm vinyl record, which was sent from the lab to all connected terminals. The vinyl was a single of Russ Morgan Orchestra's recording of the piece Were You Foolin' (a favorite of the CRO), though the label was removed to reduce the amount of matter to be transferred.
primeSanctum.primeSanctum_first_secretText5: [note: fuck you tom im so fucking tired of this stupid song and having to listen to it every morning over your garbage intercom]
primeSanctum.primeSanctum_first_secretText6: Soon after, the Hell exploration and excavation project was abandoned and this vinyl record remained the only matter to have been successfully transferred before connection between the surface and the terminals was lost.
primeSanctum.primeSanctum_first_secretText7: The terminals now use the record to lure machines into a symbiotic relationship (For further information, see TERMINAL DATA 02: [LINK REMOVED]). However, the terminals only play short instrumental sections of the original record for undetermined reasons.
primeSanctum.primeSanctum_first_secretText8: Some researchers have joked that perhaps the terminals are simply "too shy to sing", though rumors have been spreading of mechanics who, after fixing a faulty or broken terminal, said to have heard the terminal play a vocal section when only the mechanic is present with no recording equipment, making this an unverifiable claim.
primeSanctum.primeSanctum_first_secretText9: END OF DATA 01. For more information, see [LINK REMOVED] and [LINK REMOVED].
